user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I can’t say enough good things about this duo. I purchased the papaya color, and when I opened it I was a little surprise how light the color looked. But WOW was I shocked when I put it on. The colors are so well pigmented, and stay all day! You only need a little bit and this color gives you the perfect sun kissed cheeks. I also love the highlighter. It’s not too intense but gives a pretty glow. An absolute staple in my everyday line up.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: First Kosås product and well worth it. Absolutely love this duo; it is a perfect color match for my skin tone (light with golden/olive undertones, typically use RMS Un CoverUp #22 for reference) and both the bronzer/highlighter blend easily into skin. Depending on one’s brush you can definitely build up intensity without patchiness. The compact/mirror itself are well-made too - highly recommend!

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Age 18-24', 'Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
Disclaimer: I did not purchase this product from Sephora but from the last edit for FFF. I am here to say that I absolutely love this duo and provide my experience to help out some others (I purchased contrachroma. I am fair with olive undertones). I am shocked at some of the negative reviews because the formula is beautiful. The blush looks exactly like a natural sunburn look and the highlight is what I would consider a grown up highlight- subtle but stunning. I am seeing a lot of reviews that make it seem like there is a discrepancy of product quality which really saddens me. If you are on the fence about purchasing just be aware of what the product is meant to do and adjust expectations accordingly. It is worth the shot to give it a try because if your quality is like mine then you will be more than happy.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
Where to begin? I really like Contrachroma as a neutral--it adds luminosity and dimension and makes a nice counterpoint to a bright lip. There's a bit of kick-up (i.e. a loose burst of product when you pass your brush over the surface) --annoying but workable. Now a caveat: Sephora is a reliable source for Kosas stuff and I'd rely on them for the following reason: I recently ordered directly from the company (they had a $20-off blush sale) and, on receiving the product, it became apparent that they were trying to shift old stock (hence, the sale). The quality was different (really loose and chalky), the compact was different, and the expiry label read 18 months, as opposed to 6 months. It seemed a bit iffy to me and put a sour taste in my mouth for the brand in general.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
Kickback is insane!! I got helios, tropic equinox, and contrachroma hi intensity. Helios is burnt orange, tropic equinox is golden, and contrachroma HI is brick red with mauvy undertones. I have light medium olive skin and C HI blush i could sheer out and get that sunburnt mauvy look but the highlighter was too dark so i used it as topper. Also reason why i got HI bec online swatches the regular one looks lighter than tropic equinox and i wanted something darker but i prolly should ve gotten regular one instead. I use mostly kosas cream blushes so i didnt know the kickback on their powders are insane literally flying everywhere so make sure to be gentle, and blend on your arm first before applyin on face bec its super pigmented. Left-helios,middle- contrachroma HI, right-tropic equinox. Swatch and blended.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: Lovely color, fairly light but buildable, not orange. The highlight works all over the face and on the inner corners of eyes, cupids bow...It's almost like a finishing powder blush, I'm tempted to get another because I like this one so much.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: This was my first Kosas blush purchase, I LOVE these colors. I think its a great way to get a peachy color that works for fall because its not too bright but I also think this would work in the spring/summer with bronzed skin. Great pigmentation and smooth application.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content:
I struggled to choose a star rating for this product because I'm 50/50 on it. I have the shade Longitude Zero and while the blush is really nice, the highlighter is probably the worst I've ever tried. It just does not leave a nice finish on the skin. I would not say the highlight is glittery but when blended it does leave particles of chunky shimmer just sitting on top of the skin. It has a very subtle pink-ish sheen that I don't find to be buildable. I can't speak to the other shades but the Longitude Zero highlight is a dud. The Longitude Zero blush is really pretty and has nice pigmentation. It is matte but not a super flat matte. I think the finish is gorgeous. If both the blush and the highlight were great, it would be worth the money. But I'm not sure it's worth it for the blush only.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: I’m medium-toned. This was beautiful! To use as a blush, bronzer, and beautifulllllll eyeshadow as well. The highlight is a bit too golden/rosy but using both colors combined for a beautiful blush is incredible. Light application is suggested. Apply in layers and you’ll be a stunner. product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: Stand out blushers!!! The best ones out there
review_content:
Hands down one of the best blushes I’ve ever tried. The formula is super buttery and pigmented and glides smooth on my dry skin. I’ve tried pretty much every blush out there and this one stands out. A little goes a long way. All the colors are beautiful especially the bronzer (contrachroma)..reminds me of Serge Lutens blusher #1 minus the price tag. The best part of Kosas is the cost is affordable and it’s a super clean product!!! I have three of the powder blushes (contrachroma, papaya, and longitude zero) can’t wait to buy the rest!!!

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Age over 54', 'Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content:
Longitude Zero has the elusive, balanced pink I've always sought but never found. It shows up well but still looks natural on my light, cool-toned skin. It’s highly pigmented and takes some work to blend but the result is color without a powdery texture. The highlighter is subtle, non-shimmery and works well for me although I’m not especially skillful or painstaking with makeup. This blush works with cool or warm colored clothing, and I'm pretty sure is going to work year-round.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: A little goes a long way with this product. The highlight is stunning- it’s not glittery or chunky, it just looks natural and beautiful. The blush is also nice BUT because it’s so pigmented, it can be a bit tricky to work with at first. It’s a great product, just be sure to tap off the excess!

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo

review_content:
Wow this is pigmented!!! I’m not sure whether I will keep because I’m barely using any to perfect my look and it expires in six months. The small window of use aside, this blush is great! I was searching for a new blush when the bare minerals blush i bought made me breakout. I have been using for over two weeks and no new breakouts!! I have seriously special skin, dry, reactive, sensitive, and acne prone and this worked well for me. I’d definitely recommend to anyone with sensitive skin.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: I rarely write reviews, but this is such a an awesome blush-highlighter combo. The blush is a gorgeous, natural looking, and has great staying power. I like how buildable it is. And the highlighter is very natural, not all glittery. And the biggest plus for me is that it is working for my very sensitive skin. Purchased in the Contrachroma, but will also purchase in a pink tone as well.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: Wasn’t impressed. Highlight didn’t show up on me at all and blush color was just okay but definitely not worth the price. I like my BareMinerals blush way better. Ended up returning this.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Age 18-24', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I love that this have the Clean at Sephora seal (which is why I tried it). I love the Contrachroma color because it is nude (not pink as most blushes are) however, it does not last long (I have to reapply after a few hours). The highlighter does not highlight and the highlighter portion broke apart into pieces after about 1 month (and I don't travel with it) :(

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: 12 Hour Color, 5 Second Application, the BEST!
review_content: This color outlast my oily, dewy skin and looks freshly applied many hours later! I have all the Kosas pressed blushes and enjoy them all, but Papaya 1972 is my favorite. I also use the highlighter as an all-lid eyeshadow and give a subtle luminesence to my eyes. Great product, highly recommend :-)

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: I really like this blush and I like that it has clean ingredients! I am fair/light skin tone with neutral/warm undertones and it gives me a nice warm glow-it’s pretty and love that it came with the highlighter! It’s a good everyday blush and I would buy it again

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: I think the color of the blush is lovely and looks like a natural flush. The highlighter is a bonus and the palette will last a long time. It will probably expire before I've used it up. The blush gives great color pay-off and the highlighter isn't "glittery". A good alternative to Orgasm blush if you're looking for a more natural product.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo

If I could take 3 beauty products to have with me, Contrachroma would be one of them. I literally hit pan on it and just bought a new one. I use it every time I do makeup. product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: My go-to blush color is a warm coral and this is exactly that. If you’re looking for a clean alternative to your current blush this is a great one to switch to. The color is beautiful and it blends easily. A little goes a long way.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: I use the blush as a bronzer. It’s very subtle but buildable and I really like the formula. The highlighter is a bit of a letdown because it accentuates my textures and pores. It gives a perfectly work appropriate glow though. I’d recommend this for those who have very little flaws around the cheeks.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Age 13-17', 'Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I purchased this before Sephora carried it, but I wanted to add a datapoint. I LOVE this duo. The highlight is gorgeous, and the blush is somewhere inbetween mauve/bronze/peach on me. It's hard to describe. I would say it is even more flattering than my natural flush. I love this and plan to use it for a long time!

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Oily']

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I’m really pale. I typically only buy very pink products because anything with brown tones tends to make me look dirty. This looks freaking beautiful on. With just the blush, my face does the usual dirty and uneven thing. But as soon as I add the highlighter on my cheekbones and blend a little- magic. Blends perfectly and looks totally natural. This is subtle. Not all glitzy. Lasts all day.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content:
I have all 3 pressed blushes and all 3 shades are creamy, highly pigmented , and leave a beautiful airbrushed finish. Contrachroma is a rosy bronze shade that is stunning on skin. The longitude zero is the perfect rosy pink shade that is buildable. Papaya is wonderful summer shade - a coral that brightens the face . I sometimes mix the colors to get different shades ! The highlighter is perfect - not sparkly, just illuminating. The color lasts about 8 hours when I set it with RMS tinted unpowder (with Kosas tinted face oil underneath ).

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Pressed Powder Blush & Highlighter Duo

review_content:
Best blushes ever. Have been using these for months, so excited to see them at Sephora. Only blush / highlighter that wont break me out or irritate my skin. Longitude Zero and Contrachroma are the best. Contrachroma works as a contour / bronzer. The only negative is that they have a 6 month shelf life, so you have to swap them out often. But very worth it. The most natural looking highlighter and blush I have found.
